Articles.Content:
In this story, I will be describing the first contact between humanity and Kerbalkind. Pretend that the Kerbol system is scaled up to real size, while still having the same planets. I am also including the OPM planets.

Date: 7/25/2077 Location: Low Earth Orbit 

Interstellar Probe 37 was docked to the carrier ship that contained the reactors and Alcubierrie drives. It flew to a newly discovered solar system and released the probe.

To be continued...

Edited January 5, 2016 by KAL 9000

The probe flew towards the system's sun, designated K-3R-B0L. It discovered 5 inner, rocky planets, 4 outer gas giants, and a small icy dwarf at the edge of the system's planetary part. It also discovered several moons. Interestingly enough, the third planet, K-3R-B0Ld, and the first moon of the sixth planet, K-3R-B0Lg I, appeared to have liquid water on thier surfaces. As the probe flew closer, Mission Control ordered it to enter orbit around K-3R-B0Ld. It flew into a circular 250km polar orbit around it.

--Meanwhile--

"Jeb, we have detected an unidentified object entering orbit around Kerbin. It performed an orbital insertion, a plane change, and a circularization. We need you, Bill, Bob, and Val to investigate."

"Roger that."

"We have the space shuttle Explosion waiting on the pad, but before you investigate, Zaltonic needs you to repair their communications satellite in keyosynchronus orbit."

The Explosion lifted of the pad, its four enormous SRBs shooting it up like a... like a rocket (which it was).

"SRB sep. 30 km up, 45 km downrange. Beginning roll program."

This was the most dangerous part of the mission, other than reentry. Gene hoped the little shuttle would make it into space, remembering the Khallenger disaster.

"We are in orbit and proceeding to the comsat. Cargo bay doors... open. Solar panels... extended."

--At the probe--

[Radar]: Unidentified object detected taking off from the surface of K-3R-B0Ld.

[Antenna]: Reporting to Mission Control.

--Back on Earth--

"It appears that there is an intelligent race on that planet."

"Hello, you've reached the President of the United States- You've found WHAT!?!?"

"Ms. Secretary of State, please get me the heads of the army and NASA."

"So, gentlemen, we've found an alien race. NASA Administrator-"

"My name is Todd."

"-Erm, Todd, could you please explain where this planet is. And General, draw up plans for an invasion of this planet."

"Wait, WHAT?" interjected the scientist administrator. "You can't just invade inhabited planets wildly-nilly!"

"Nonsense! This planet, um, what was it again?"

"K-3R-B0Ld."

"Yes, that's it! This planet, K-3R-B0Ld, will become the 51st state!"

Americans are a weird people!

Also you fic remind me an old Nassault movie:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YWI8qkdu7z0

21 hours ago, Nahim said:

Americans are a weird people!

Also you fic remind me an old Nassault movie:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YWI8qkdu7z0

 

Not just Americans. It's probably what humanity would do. We're jerks.
Wow this is cool  Keep going!!!

MOAR, you say? MOAR you shall have!

"Approaching the unidentified object."

"Be careful, Jeb."

Jeb flew over and saw some strange symbols. One of them looked like NASA and another looked like UNITED STATES. He took out his kPhone and snapped pictures of them, and he emailed the pictures to KSC. Wernher and his team began to decipher them. He jetted over to the probe's camera (although he didn't know it was a camera) and poked it. Nothing happened visibly, but the probe's antenna had transmitted that it had discovered the alien species. Val, controlling the shuttle's robot arm (©Infernal Robotics) and moved its "hand" over to the equipment rack in the cargo bay. Bill, on EVA as well, secured a KAS electromagnet to the arm's "hand". Val piloted the robot arm to the probe, some 10 meters away, and grabbed it with the electromagnet. The probe was carefully moved to the cargo bay, and Bill used some duct tape to secure it. After the shuttle had landed, engineers took the probe over to the lab. Thier plan was to bring me the probe back to orbit where it had been found as soon as communication had been established.

Meanwhile, the president was furious. Those little alien things were on HIS invasion target, and they had captured the probe-turned-spy-sattelite! He called out orders to construct an invasion fleet.

To be continued...

Excellent, I wouldn't be surprised if the president was angry at kerbal kind  

You know that we could be mixed up a lot... 

 

Edited January 20, 2016 by RA3236

I know you only meant it as a joke, and I apologize for sounding so harsh.  It's just if any of the moderators think this is getting political in anyway, they'll lock it up.  I've seen it happen on here before.

The day of the invasion has come...

The Kerbals also recently invented Alcubierrie drives, and they were preparing to begin their own exploration of the Galaxy.

--Year 2115 (Kerbal time), Day 257, Hour 4; Tracking Station, KSC, Klathuu, Kerbin--

"Sir, we've detected a group of large unidentified spacecraft dropping out of warp. They are proceeding towards the inner Kerbol system at 1,500 km/s. They appear to be using nuclear fusion drives. They are also moving directly towards Kerbin."

Bob was reading A Jool Odyssey, the third installment to the Kerbfleet series, written by system-famous author Kuzzter Kerman, when the message came through that their ship was to greet the unidentified ships and establish communications. He was startled out of his chair and floated to the ceiling.

"What's wrong, buddy?" questioned Bill as he floated by. Just then, the ship came within 100 km of the alien ships, and Val, having been chosen as the temporary Diplomatic Officer (after a heated game of Rocket, Paper, Scissors) started transmitting to the alien ships.

"Hello? Hello? Anyone hear me?"

"Val, you forgot to turn on the antenna."

"Oh, ok, it's on now."

"Hello? Hello?"

The alien ship responded by shooting a missile at them.

"We're losing power! Engines are offline! Reactor is overloaded! Life support is failing!"

Jeb frantically slammed the ABORT button and announced over the Klaxon alarms, "Abandon ship! To the escape pods!" The computer calmly stated, "Please proceed to your designated escape pod. Don't forget your snacks, and remember, panic is advised."

Sorry it's been a while, but I'm updating!

--Year 2115 (Kerbal time), Day 258, Hour 2; Tracking Station, KSC, Klathuu, Kerbin--

"Um... Boss, this is Klemny Kerman. I've got a radio transmission coming in on most frequencies. It appears to be of intelligent origin."

"Go ahead, translate it, please."

"'We are the Borg. You will be assimilated. Resistance is futile.'"

"That makes no sense."

"Whoops, trying again..."

"'[CENSORED] [CENSORED] [CENSORED]' No, definitely not that one!"

"'Hello, aliens. We are invading your planet. If you surrender, there is a small chance that we will consider sparing some of your lives. If not, you will all be exterminated. Good-bye.'"
